result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing Hearing on December 13, 2018
Reporter: Jill Bartol
re: post-conviction relief from Atty Wilsnack

09:34 AM Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the revocation packet and are prepared to proceed.  Atty Wilsnack agrees.  
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments.
Court questions the State as to the 45 days credit as to the inpatient treatment.  Atty Hendee responds.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT: Court orders 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 18 months Initial Confinement and 30 months Extended Supervision with conditions:
Credit = 186 days
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Any costs and fees to be paid while on extended supervision
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Eligible for Challange Incarceration Program

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 13, 2018 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 30, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zamzow states that her and her client have received a copy of the PSI and have no changes.
Atty Hendee asks the court to confirm that the defense is ok with him and the court to proceed due to treatment court.  Court questions the defense.  Atty Zamzow has no issues with Atty Hendee or your honor for continuation of the case.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.
Atty Hendee wants to make it clear about the restitution; the defendant has already been paying on the restitution and has made $122.78 towards that restitution.  Atty Hendee asks the court to order the whole restitution amount but would like that amount to be known that it was paid through probation.  Atty Zamzow agrees to that.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions: 
60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; conditional time
  Report on or before February 3, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Restitution = $1,445.00 + $144.50 = $1,589.50 (to be paid during probation period; same amount was ordered in 15CM30 as well and is paying on it)
Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Eligible for Challange Incarceration Program
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Credit to be determined by written stipulation at a later date.

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Motion hearing on June 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM30 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the defendant from the Treatment Court program.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is not objecting to the termination.  Atty Zamzow received the motion and states that the defendant is in agreement and does not object to termination of the program.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion of the treatment court team and the defendant will be terminated from the Treatment Court Program.

Atty Hendee states that part of the court order in 15CM30, the defendant has 60 days imposed of jail time for use of the treatment court program.  Atty Hendee asks that the stay of the remaining jail time be lifted and the defendant to serve his remaining sentence.
Atty Zamzow does not object and asks that the defendant continue to receive huber privilages.

BY THE COURT:  Court will lift the stay of the remainder jail sentence of 38 days.  Huber is granted.
Set for Motion.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Status conference at 06-18-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. D.A. plea hearing to all 3 cases 15 CM 29 & 30 also. Count 1 15 CF 11 felony theft; no contest 1 & 2 15 CM 30. Dismiss count 2 in 15 CF 11 as well as dismiss & read in balance of charges15 CM 30 & 15 CM 29 Count 2 15 CF 11 dismiss & read in. DPA 24 mo - Treatment Court condition on DPA. Treatment plea agreement change case number to 15 CF 11 & 15 CM 30 counts 1 & 2. 15 CM 30- withhold sent 24 mo prob.- 60 days jail on count 1 stayed for use in treatment court- $243.00 ea count; restitution $1445.00 15 CF 11 & $572.47 in 15 CM 30. 10% rest. surcharge. Atty Gumz agrees and agrees with restitution amount.  Defendant entered No contest plea. Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
Court: 15 CF 11 Court approves DPA 24 mo.w/Treatment Court condition; 15 CM 30 Counts 1 & 2 withhold sentence 24 mo probation. 60 days jail on Count 1, stay for use in treat Ct; $243.00 each count; treatment & counseling as recommended. Restitution as requested in both cases as probation condition. 101 sentence credit only apply if DPA is terminated or probation revoked. Report to Ms Runge for bracelet. 24 hrs to report to 
Dismiss & read in: count 2 in 15 CF 11; 15 CM 29 & balance of 15 CM 30
D.A. in custody -101 sentence credit if sentenced on 15 CF 11; victim impact statements provided to Court. Defendant will be released today. Need to report to Sheila Runge. Atty Gumz had contact with victims.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Return date at 06-04-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant is in custody on a cash bond.  The defendant has gone through the assessment process with Treatment Court Coordinator Sheila Runge and will be discussed tomorrow at the meeting.  
Atty Gumz asks for a reset to allow time for the team to meet about treatment court.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to modify the bond by the defendant.  Atty Gumz states motion and asks for a signature bond.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant may be looking into treatment court.  
Atty Hendee is open to the defendant being released soley for a treatment court assessment only and asks that the cash bond remain the same.
Atty Gumz states that Ms. Runge could meet with the defendant on Friday.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant's motion to modify the cash bond is denied.  
Atty Gumz is to get a specific time for the defendant to meet with the coordinator and the jail is to transport the defendant Friday afternoon to meet with Ms. Runge the Treatment Court Coordinator and then after the evaluation the defendant will be transported back to jail.
Bail/bond hearing at 04-27-2015 03:15 pm
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FORMODIFICATION OF BAIL

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf in custody.  Andrew J. Christenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Christenson files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return

Defendant Tyler J. Reepsdorf by video, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests $500 cash bond to be applied to both this case and 15CM29.  Defendant requests signature bond.
